inn1.comm: a hint of wobble, away from the bat, to start, and a length delivery is nudged to extra cover
outswinger again from Panyangara, but it's too short and too wide and sits up outside off to be powerfully cut away behind point
now this one snakes in through the air, but it's picked off the pads for a single to square leg.
some extra bounce off a length, and the ball is fended one-handed into the leg side to get Shahzad off the mark
an outswinger is left well alone. It was up there to drive but the batsman couldn't be tempted.
sharp end to the over, another outswinger fizzing past the outside edge of a defensive bat
dismissive! Jongwe slung down a bouncer to start, but Shahzad was back and across in a flash to hook it to fine leg. Didn't bother to keep it down
four more! Shahzad leaps up on one leg to flay another short ball through point this time
a better length from Jongwe, and the ball is nudged to mid on.
flicked off the pads to deep midwicket for one.
good running. The ball is flicked to the left of Raza at midwicket, and though he cuts it off the call comes early
Jongwe is a bit all over the place with his length. This is short outside off again, and Panyangara has to sprint around from third man to stop Shahzad's cut
Noor Ali stands up tall to punch a rising delivery at the point fielder
a probing length, right at the top of off, and it's solidly defended back to the bowler
left well alone this time. Good carry through to the keeper
and again, Noor Ali shoulders arms. This ball was quite full outside off, but Mutumbami has pouched it at shoulder height
Panyangara is a contrast to his opening partner. He bounds in and hits a good length, just on off stump, and the batsman must defend.
Noor Ali is half forward to push an away swinging length delivery to Raza in the covers.
a little too straight, coming in to the pads with the arm, and the batsmen rush through for two leg byes.
hopping defence from Shahzad now as Jongwe hits a length outside off.
watchfully defended back to the bowler once again.
no defence there! Jongwe floats one down to full and Shahzad whips it powerfully to wide long-on with a wristy flick
full and on the pads, and the ball is clipped to long leg for one.
Jongwe finds his length again, and Noor Ali pushes the ball softly back to him.

this has gone miles up in the air! Shahzad wasn't trying anything too dramatic as he flicked to leg, but he played under a ball that rose on him and the top edge almost kissed the low cloud covering the ground before rocketing back down to earth, where Mutumbami was waiting to catch it.
snaking away from the bat outside off, but the ball is eased down to third man for one with no alarm
metronomic stuff from Panyangara, and the batsman can only press half forward to nudge the ball back to the bowler
play and a miss outside off! The batsman wanted to cut, but the extra bounce and away movement beat him
and now Panyangara is back to his regular length, aiming for the top of off, and the ball is defended into the covers
he's manufactured a nice little shot here, angling the blade to get a length ball to point, but he's picked out the fielder
Nabi raises his arms to leave, and safely so. The ball swung in quite sharply, but only after it had passed the stumps
played late and right under the eyes, a defensive stroke sends the ball rolling into the covers
too straight from Jongwe, and Nabi collects a brace to midwicket
spanked away off the front foot. This was a sort of front foot cut shot, and Nabi threaded the gap between point and cover point perfectly. Too much width from the bowler
Jongwe's not found his radar this morning, and this ball is speared down the leg side
that's better. On a length just outside off, and it's left alone.
a wicket to wicket line, and the ball is turned into the leg side field.
change-up from Panyagara - the inswinger - and it hits the batsman on the leg above the knee roll.
and now the outswinger, which rises up and past Noor Ali's cut shot, beating the edge.
flicked neatly into the leg side. No great power, but the placement between midwicket and mid on is such that they take an easy single.
and he's immediately into action to stop an attempted glide to third man.
a touch too straight, and Nabi works a single off his hip.
sharp delivery! It nipped in off the track, and the batsman was in no position to play it. He's struck on the pad, but there's no appeal as there seemed an inside edge.
not a great start from the new bowler as he pushes one down the leg side
adjusts his line, on a length outside off and it's tapped into the covers
big appeal for lbw! It looked like a strong shout from up here, Nabi playing across his front pad and missing the ball, but it could well have been headed down the leg side
full and straight from Chamu, and the ball is nudged to midwicket.
floated out wide, inviting the drive, and the ball is sliced off the outer half of a driving bat, bouncing safely down to third man
neatly driven off the front foot, but straight to Chigumbura at mid-off
once again Noor Ali comes forward to drive, but throws more into this shot and aims it right between the mid-off and cover fielders. Top shot.
the batsman is caught flat-footed by a good length outswinger, but good hands help him defend to cover
probing stuff from Panyangara, and once again the batsman is only half-forward in defence
pushed out a little wider, and Nabi throws his hands through another of those front foot cut shots - but it's cut off at point.
no cutting that off. Panyangara offered a half volley outside off, looking for swing, but Nabi was more than equal to it and sent the ball to the cover boundary with a cracking shot.
edged up and over a leaping Ervine at slip! Another flashing stroke, but he got just enough on it to beat the fielder
pitched up, just outside off, and the ball is driven into the covers
comprehensively beaten! Noor Ali stepped forward, back, and then across as he fished at this delivery outside off. Nothing on it.
good comeback from the batsman! Chamu slipped this one down too straight, and the batsman chipped it up and over midwicket for four
full and straight once more, but the shot is much more conservative and it's stopped at mid on.
an angled bat sends the ball to the point fielder, stopped on the bounce.
this is slightly uppish as the ball is turned to midwicket, but it bounces safely in front of Raza in that position
tapped gently to cover point to end the over.
driven hard, but Raza gets a hand to it to stop the shot at cover. That must have stung a bit, there was a loud slap as the ball hit his hand.
curving away off a good length outside off, and it's left alone.
now Masakaza at point is in action to stop a well-struck square drive.
full and straight, and Panyangara stops the straight drive in his follow through
Noor Ali taps the ball in front of point and wants a single, but Masakadza is in too quickly and he's sent back
driven in the air, but safely through the gap between cover and point. Just a single.
driven watchfully to mid-on to start.
tapped slightly straighter this time, and there's room for a quick single
Nabi presses forward and defends to point.
clipped off the toes for a single into the deep
nicely bowled, landing on a good length from around the wicket, and it's pushed back to the bowler.
and the same again, Masakadza fielding off his bowling as bright sunshine breaks through the clouds and spills across the ground. It's a pretty picture
well, there was a loud crack off the swinging bat, but the ball went absolutely nowhere, trickling into the leg side.
driven into the covers off the front foot.
drift and turn beats the batsman's sweep! He's hit on the pad, but it's heading down the leg side.
pushed into the covers once more.
sharp single! The ball was driven to Chigumbura's right at mid-off, and the call was early but the batsmen really had to motor to get home safely.
squeezed out to backward point.
Nabi comes down the track to meet the ball on the half volley, but there's no timing in his drive and the ball is stopped at extra cover.
Nabi is well forward to defend.
a little too short, but the ball rushes on to hurry a punch into the covers.
eased down to long on.
whipped flamboyantly off the pads and out to deep midwicket for a couple
beaten on the outside edge! The batsman tried to cut, but it fizzed past him.
driven down to long-off.
too straight, and he's glanced down to the vacant fine leg region for two
looped right up to the bat, dug out back to the bowler.
punched with some flourish to midwicket.
full and wide outside off, and he's driven out square to the cover sweeper.
driven watchfully to extra cover.
Noor Ali is down the wicket to meet the ball on the full, driving just wide of mid-on.
punched firmly back to the bowler.
turned into the leg side, and the batsman wanders out to look for a single but Mutumbami sprints out of his position to stop him
paddle swept with no great timing to short fine leg.
a diving Chigumbura stops a drive at extra cover, and that's the over.
quicker one from Chisoro, and it's hurriedly pushed back at the bowler
another dart from Chisoro, but this time it's too short and too wide, and is punched out through extra cover.
eased down to long-on for a jogged single.
looped down a little slower, and a drive is squirted to Raza at cover.
handsome drive! But the fielding is equally good by Raza at cover to stop the shot, one-handed.
appeal for lbw as the batsman is struck on the pads, but this one had drifted on with the arm from around the wicket and was probably headed down the leg side.
pushed firmly to Chigumbura at extra cover, off the back foot.
dispatched! Nabi jumps down and absolutely hammers this straight drive. I didn't even see where it came down, but it was beyond the sight screen at the Airport End.
good fielding off his own bowling by Masakadza, getting his left hand down quickly to stop a drive.
punched back to the bowler again, off the back foot.
Nabi stays deep in his crease and forces the ball to long-off.
neatly worked off the pads and out to deep square, Raza running from midwicket to haul the ball in
edged past slip! This would have been an unbelievable reflex catch had Ervine held on. The ball was a quicker one, very quick, outside off and the batsman slashed hard at it.
tapped rather less dramatically to extra cover.
looped down slowly, and it's driven back to the bowler. Chisoro is varying his pace well
flicked just wide of midwicket, who puts in a dive to stop the shot.
driven firmly to Chigumbura at extra cover.
the ball is arrowed down the leg side, but the batsman misses his sweep and is struck on the foot.
Nabi comes forward to drive through mid-off.
this is the arm ball by the looks of things, and the ball comes off the inside half of the bat before rolling to square leg.
legitimately played into the leg side this time, the ball being placed down to fine leg.
pushed back to the right of the bowler, who cuts it off.
and now Masakadza must move to his left to stop another drive.
whipped off the pads to midwicket, where Raza is after it in a flash to keep the batsmen to one.
a really quick little dart from Chisoro - harking back to his days as a left-arm seamer - and the batsman's pull is beaten.
tip and run cricket! The batsman pushed it just wide of Chigumbura at extra cover and they just set off. Fortunately the fielder's shy went wide.
driven firmly out to the sweeper cover
pushed straight back to the bowler
Raza is an electric presence in the field, and he charges in now from cover to stop any thought of a quick single in his direction.
eased down to long-on for one.
floated down full and wide outside off, slapped into the covers
driven to the right of the bowler, who stumbles into Nabi at the non-strikers end and so can't stop the shot.
sharp running after an immediate call, the ball having been nudged to midwicket
turn and bounce outside off! The batsman was back and trying to cut but the ball burst past him. Mutumbami holds it at shoulder height
solid defence into the covers
driven back to the bowler.
eased down to long-on for a single.
good fielding by Chigumbura, who rushes across from midwicket and dives to cut off a shot in his direction
nudged off the hip, the ball rolling close on the leg side but far enough to allow a single
punched down to long off off the back foot
driven in the same direction. Raza rushes across from extra cover to try to cut it off, but can't get there and long-off runs in to keep them to one
worked into space between cover and point, off the back foot
nicely played, Nabi getting right back and threading the gap to the left of Chigumbura at extra cover. Long-off cleans up
driven to long on to bring up the 100. Loud clapping from the Afghanistan changing room, which is just to my left.
clubbed over deep midwicket! When Nabi hits them, they stay hit. Once again he's cleared the stands easily with this shot, and there will be a delay as they search for the ball.
chipped up and over the bowlers head, and Nabi rushes through for his fifty. Even louder clapping and encouragement from his team-mates.
driven down to long on for one more
Nyumbu gets the long barrier out to stop this ball which is hit straight back to him
popped up and over the cover fielder! The batsman wanted to loft the ball, but didn't get quite the height he was looking fo
driven to the right of the bowler, who stops the shot with a dive
driven firmly, but straight to extra cover
pushed back to the bowler
popped in the air again, but quite safely as the ball bounces down to long-on
very full from Raza, who's stayed round the wicket, and it's dug out to extra cover.
a shocker to start! This can happen to a legspinner. The ball slips out of Tino's hand and arrives as a high full toss outside off. Noor Ali doesn't hold back, smiting the ball high over extra cover.
nudged rather more gently into the leg side, and the batsmen pinch a single as Tino fields off his own bowling
flighted outside off, inviting the drive, and it is indeed driven to long-off.
punched back to the bowler, off the back foot.
smart cricket. Nabi waits deep in his crease and then just punts the ball into the wide open space at midwicket
slapped hard into the covers off the back foot, and a diving Raza stops the shot at extra cover
looped up outside off, and he's driven down the ground.

Nabi has almost taken out your commentator with this shot! He powered the ball straight down the ground, and it very nearly came in through the open window in front of me. About a foot away from disaster/a spectacular catch, I was.
driven to extra cover.
turned into the leg side now
Noor Ali stays deep in his crease and defends off the back foot
more defence ends the over.
Noor Ali drives down the ground, checking his shot
Nabi was down into a paddle sweep position before the ball had even been bowled, and gets the ball down to fine leg.
tapped softly to extra cover, off the front foot
Fifty up for Noor Ali now! He backs away, clearing his front leg, and hacks a cut out to the cover sweeper. A patient knock, from 87 deliveries
a one handed-hoick sends the ball out to deep midwicket, but it was struck badly enough that it fell well short of the fielder.
driven straight down the ground for a single.
turned with the spin through midwicket, where there's protection on the boundary
that's into the practice nets! Nabi jumped down the track to get right next to the ball and swung cleanly through the line over the wide long-on boundary
much quicker through the air, and it's pushed back to the bowler
driven to long on
off the outside edge, and there's no slip! But short third man cuts it off
pushed back to the bowler to end the over
chipped in the air down to long on
a length delivery, rising on the leg side, is glanced through square leg
Nabi comes well forward and angles a drive out to the cover sweeper

cheeky single! Noor Ali nudged the ball almost straight to Raza, on the edge of the circle at extra cover, and they set off. Raza's throw goes wide, and he collapses onto the ground in disappointment. That would have been very close
very full on off stump, and it's dug out just wide of Chigumbura at mid off with plenty of bottom hand
slashed out to the cover sweeper, on the drive
flighted high and wide outside off, the batsman coming forward to drive out to the sweeper
plenty of flight once again, and Noor Ali clears his left leg to slash a drive up and over the cover field. The sweeper cleans up once again
slugged into the leg side, the bottom hand taking over the shot. Chisoro at mid on stops the shot
punched firmly down to long off.
driven back to the bowler, who bends low in his follow through to stop it
Noor Ali skips down the track and flicks across the line, with no great timing. But the ball goes wide of Chisoro at mid-on and they scamper a single
ouch! A drive is hammered straight back to the bowler, bouncing well in front of him and stinging his hand. The ball ricochets to mid off
full and wide, and the drive is slammed out to the cover sweeper
past the outside edge! After all these powerful shots, this was an attempted little dinky shot down to third man
and now he does lay bat on the glide to third man
a touch too straight, and he's whipped off the pads to deep midwicket
Nabi is up on his toes to ride the bounce on this short ball, turning it into the leg side but straight to the fielder

this will peg them back a little! Noor Ali set himself for a slog sweep, but the ball was fuller and straighter than he was looking for and he completely lost his shape as he swung wildly to leg. The ball ballooned high off the top edge, and Chisoro sprinted to his left from mid on to set himself under the ball as it came down not far from the non-striker's end. It wasn't the easiest catch, but he clung on with both hands.
driven to Chigumbura at extra cover. The ball bursts out of his hands, but he recovers quickly enough to deny the single
Nabi whips his wrists across this one, but he can't beat Chisoro at mid on
pushed to long off for an easy single
turn and bounce outside off! Mangal was neither forward nor back, just sitting in his crease, and the ball leapt past him, beating the edge
and now Mangal makes the right choice, coming well forward to smother the spin in defence

Mangal had to put in some long strides to get in safely! Nabi just dropped the ball close in on the off side, the non-striker calling quickly for the single. Masakadza charged in from point, but the batsman won the race
a bottom-edged cut goes through to Mutumbami, bouncing a couple of metres in front of him
driven into the covers, where Raza circles to stop the shot
nudged down behind square on the off side, and Ervine trots around from gully to keep the batsmen at home
well bowled, on a good length just outside off. Mangal comes forward to defend to cover
pushed through on a length just wide of off stump, and Mangal's outside edge is beaten as he looks for an angled shot to third man
there's a huge gap at fine leg, and Nabi finds it with a crouching paddle sweep
driven hard off the front foot, but straight to Chigumbura at extra cover
beaten on the outside edge! Nabi wanted to cut, but the ball wasn't quite short enough for it
whipped just wide of mid on with plenty of bottom hand
now it's Mangal's turn to paddle sweep. His shot beats Ervine at first, but the fielder is after it quickly and some tag-team work down the boundary keeps them to two

what a catch! Long off is out, and Chisoro is up in the circle at mid on. Mangal top edged a swipe that was aimed over Chisoro's head, but the ball swirled in the direction of mid off. The long off fielder would never have been able to get there in time, but Chisoro charged across the field and tumbled forward as the ball rocketed towards the ground, getting a hand cleanly underneath it.
chopped down in front of extra cover, who sends the batsman scampering back to his crease
another cut, and this one is bottom edged. The ball shoots between Mutumbami's legs and the batsmen pinch a single as Ervine runs around from slip
driven down the ground, long on trotting across to keep them to one
pushed firmly back to the bowler
solid forward defence ends the over
looped down very full, and the batsman skips down to meet it on the full toss and collect a single to long off.
lovely flight from Tino. He's really not afraid to give the ball plenty of air. He fields off his own bowling as the ball comes back to him
a direct hit would have had him! Stanikzai flicked the ball to Tino's right and they called for the single even as the bowler rushed across, picked up the ball and hurled it just past the stumps
the deep midwicket fielder didn't pick this up. A pull was hammered out to his left, but he initially ran to his right, before turning back. By that time, the ball was past him
out comes the paddle sweep again, and the ball rolls down to fine leg
punched firmly back to the bowler
darted in from around the stumps, Nabi driving back to the bowler
turned into the leg side now, but not past Raza at midwicket
a deft little late cut brings a single to short third man
misfield by Chigumbura in the covers! The ball was tapped to his left, but not very hard. He just over-ran it as he came in, and allowed a single
a touch short outside off, and it's cracked out to the cover sweeper
driven straight back down the ground, but not firmly enough to beat long on running around
off the outside edge! The cut was on, as the ball was short enough outside off, but it turned and bounced more than he was expecting.
pushed into the covers off the front foot.
this has soared over wide long on, and by quite a distance! Nabi is charging towards a memorable hundred
quicker through the air, and the ball squirts off the inside half of the bat, rolling to leg.
driven hard at Chigumbura at extra cover.
driven into the covers once again, and this time he threads the gap.
driven hard back down the ground. Chisoro leans down but he can only half stop it.
glanced off the pads to short fine leg
turned to midwicket

there's the hundred, his first in ODIs! Nabi glances the ball very fine on the leg side, and they charge back for the second. His team mates are all on their feet cheering him on from the changing room, and he lifts his helmet and bat in the air to acknowledge them, finally kneeling at the edge of the pitch to give thanks by performing the sajda. It's been a near flawless knock, and it's set his team up for a big total.
hacked into the covers, and he can't beat the fielder
much too short, and Nabi rocks back to pull in the air out to deep midwicket.
turned into the leg side again, this time just the one
the batsmen are using the round the wicket angle well here, picking gaps on the leg side.
eased down to long on for a single to end the over.
Tino rushes in from backward point to stop a late cut.
Nabi jumps down the track and swings mightily to leg, but he can't quite connect as he'd like and it's just the single.
punched to extra cover, off the back foot.
and now he's forward to drive to the cover sweeper.
in the air ... and safe! Nabi sliced right underneath this attempted lofted drive, and the cover sweeper charged in from the boundary as the ball looped towards him, but it dropped short.
driven through extra cover for one more.
driven through the cover field, and Panyangara charges across from long off to keep them to one.

this is the biggest six I've ever seen hit at Queens Sports Club. It's gone right over the three story building I'm in, and the ball might be out on the road. It wasn't full, and Nabi just set himself deep in the crease to have a mighty mow over long on. Massive. This is a day he'll remember.
much quicker through the air, unsurprisingly, and the ball is dug out into the leg side.
lashed through the covers.
Nabi wants to slog sweep, but he swings past the ball and is struck on the pads. Outside leg.
whipped firmly off the back foot and out to deep midwicket.
driven to long on.
Nabi stands at the crease and sends the ball to long off with a brutal forehand stroke.
nudged into space in the covers, one more.
driven past the bowler's out-stretched left hand and down to long off.
flicked off the toes to midwicket, where several fielders converge to cut it off.

a fine knock comes to an end! Unselfish batting from Nabi. He was targeting the wide long-on boundary, looking for six, but it was a tired-looking shot and the bat turned in his hands as he played it. The ball still went very high in the air, but Chamu Chibhabha has a safe pair of hands in the outfield and he held it cleanly.
Masakadza stays round the wicket to the left-handed Naijibullah, who is off the mark with a tip-and-run single into the covers.
a booming, extravagant drive outside off stump connects with nothing but fresh air. Masakadza is giving the ball absolutely zero flight.
dug out to midwicket.
again Stanikzai looks to midwicket, but this time he can't quite pick the gap as well so it's just one.
cut hard, but straight to point.

well held by Ervine! Najibullah slogged at this one angling across him, and the top edge looked like it might fall safely at short third man. But Ervine, who was at gully, nipped across at full speed and caught it on the run, over his shoulder. Afghanistan are stumbling a little now.
flung down flat and fast on off stump, and the ball is dug out back to the bowler.
a touch more flight on this one, and it's driven to long off.
a quicker one again, that left-arm pacer's delivery from Chisoro with a quick arm, and it flies off the outside edge and down to third man. Panyangara sprints from short third man to cut it off
driven just wide of cover.
flashed out through cover
a big swing and a miss to a quick ball outside off stump.
flicked just wide of the square leg fielder.
the batsman swings right across the line to get the ball to midwicket.
the burly quick aims for the yorker, but the ball slips out as a dipping full toss. Dug out into the leg side.
they're swinging at everything now, and this is slugged into the leg side.

great effort from a diving Mutumbami, but he can't get a glove to this! The ball was short and the batsman hooked at it. The top edge wasn't a quick one, but it was just enough to beat the leaping keeper.
slammed down to long on, another big shot, but along the ground.
good start! Jongwe's first ball is a bulls-eye yorker outside off stump, and it rushes underneath the bat.
on a yorker length once more, and just outside off, but this time the batsman is waiting for it and toe ends a shot into the covers
massive wide outside off stump. You can see what he's trying to do, aiming for these wide yorkers, but this one was too far.
full and straight, and long on has some work to do running in to keep them to a single
full and much too wide again, the batsman stretches out but can't reach it
that's much better from the bowler. Again he's on target with his length, the ball landing right in the blockhole and beating the batsman's swing to leg.
he's down the track now, and drives the ball on the full out to wide long off. Masakadza sprints around from long off to stop the boundary

good work from Mutumbami! The batsman was looking to Dilscoop the ball over short fine leg, but it was a sharp yorker and nipped under his bat, hitting his knee. Mutumbami had to dive to his right to stop the ricochet.

ah, that's poor bowling with fine leg up inside the circle. Panyangara offered the batsman a length delivery, slipping towards leg stump, and Stanikzai just lapped it on its way, easily beating Ervine at short fine leg.

gone this time! Panyangara flings down a fast bouncer, perhaps taking the batsman by surprise. Stanikzai is late on the ball, the ball coming off the splice and looping down to long leg, where Luke Jongwe holds the catch right in front of his face.
another bouncer from Panyangara! He's not the quickest, but this was the effort ball and it seemed to beat the batsman for pace.
well, his opening spell was exemplary but Panyangara's not been at his best at the death. An attempted yorker slips way, way down the leg side.
an over-correction results in a long half volley outside off, and it's walloped through the cover field. Nobody moved
and another! Shenwari might have expected that the follow-up would be a short ball, and he was waiting in the crease for this one, fetching it out to the deep midwicket boundary.
just short of a good length again, and the batsman collects two more as the fielder at deep midwicket fumbles.
slashed up and over backward point, the cover sweeper stopping the boundary.
crunched down the ground now, and the fielder is in quickly to keep them to one,
another slashing shot outside off stump, and the ball flies quickly down to third man, where Panyangara has to rush across to stop runs
smeared through cover point off the front foot.
a diving stop by Chamu at extra cover keeps them to one.

emphatic shot to end the innings! Rashid Khan is a 17 year old playing in his first international match, but he looks right at home playing his shots. He clears his left leg and biffs a full ball handsomely up and over extra cover for four.

inn2.comm: good start from the seamer, hitting a length outside off. Chamu leaves well alone.
same again from Aftab, and once again Chamu leaves. There doesn't look like a great deal of swing.
swing and a miss outside off! Chamu set himself to cut, and the shot was on, but the ball burst past the outside edge.
Chamu is away with that characteristic flick off the pads through midwicket.
edged! But safely down to third man. Mutumbami was also aiming to cut, but there was a touch of extra bounce, and the ball flew threw a third slip position.
fuller and straighter from Aftab, Mutumbami crouching forward to defend.
lift and movement outside off for Dawlat. But Mutumbami was perfectly safe raising his arms to leave.
Dawlat hits a length outside off, curling the ball away from the bat, and Mutumbami steps across to defend to point.
Mutumbami shoulders arms once more, having a good look at the new ball.
a flashing blade, but no connection! Dawlat is finding significant movement off the seam, away from the bat, rather than outright swing.
another play-and-miss! Dawlat is really testing Mutumbami outside off stump with pace and bounce.
no stopping this one. The batsman strikes back with a sure-footed stroke through cover point. Mutumbami came forward to attack the ball, swinging cleanly through the line.
off the legs, and well struck too. Aftab offered up a leg stump delivery and Chamu flicked it cleanly, and wide of midwicket.
Aftab readjusts, aiming outside off, and Chamu's drive is intercepted at cover
good, probing length. Chamu can only get half forward to defend. Can Aftab keep it there?
good lines, good lengths. Chamu defends firmly back to the bowler, who leaps in his follow through to stop the ball and then threatens to throw down the stumps.
crunched, on the up, through extra cover. Aftab offered width, and Chamu seized the opportunity with a backfoot punch. The ball holds up on the thick outfield.
Mutumbami shuffles across to off stump and nudges a single off his hips to keep strike.
Dawlat slings down a short ball outside off, and Mutumbami drops his hand to let it pass him.
this time Mutumbami stands tall to cut, the ball flying quickly down to third man. Good shot, if slightly hurried.
Chamu meets a length delivery with a little shuffle forward and a high left elbow, the ball bouncing to extra cover.

an early wicket! Dawlat targeted Chibhabha with a short ball, and the batsman swiveled back to pull. But he couldn't get himself into position quickly enough, the ball skewing off the splice and looping tamely to the mid-on fielder.
great delivery first up to the left hander! Dawlat hits a perfect line, just outside off, and a little seam movement takes the ball past the outside edge.
and now an lbw appeal! Ervine missed a flick to leg and was struck on the right pad, but the umpire is unmoved. That looked to have pitched outside leg.
Mutumbami keeps his hands high to ride the bounce on a rising delivery, working the ball into the leg side.
speared down the leg side, and called wide.
Aftab pitches one right up to the bat, and though Mutumbami meets it with the full face his shot goes straight to mid-off.
a touch too straight from the bowler, and he's clipped out to long leg for one.
Ervine comes forward to meet a length delivery, playing the ball very late and angling his bat to get a single to third man.
well bowled, aimed at the top of off stump, and Mutumbami defends.
left alone outside off stump. The ball dies in front of Shahzad, and he pads it away to gully, but there's no room for a stolen bye.
Ervine turns his wrists over a length delivery on middle and off to find a single through square leg.
Mutumbami is right across on off stump to this straight delivery, but gets his pad down in front of his pad to defend safely enough
worked neatly off the hip, and the batsmen trot through for a single.
this has pinged right out of the middle of the bat! Dawlat was aiming for Ervine's pads, and the batsman clipped the full, swinging delivery firmly through midwicket.
on a length just outside off, defended calmly to cover.

a full ball hits the seam and jags away from the bat, fizzing past Ervine! There's an appeal for caught behind, then another, then another! But the umpire says no to all of them. Afghanistan were convinced, and it looked like Shahzad had plenty to say to the batsmen as the field changed.

and he's immediately slog swept to deep square leg! Mutumbami wasting no time getting after the spinner. He bent down low and hammered this high in the air, the ball landing right on the boundary marker.
much quicker through the air, and it's tapped back to the bowler.
worked with the spin, just wide of mid-on, and they take a single.
Ervine is well forward to smother a full delivery outside off.
straight back over the bowler's head! This was pitched right up on middle and leg, and Ervine chipped it always looking to play with the full face of the bat
full and straight once more, and it's flicked to square leg.
on a length, wobbling away outside off. There was width if Ervine wanted the shot, but he didn't and left it alone.
straighter from the bowler, aimed right at off stump, and Ervine defends.
that's a cracking cover drive. Ervine seemed to have so much time as he leaned forward into the ball, checking his shot. But the timing was supreme, and so was the placement.
Dawlat puts a little more vim into this length delivery, and Ervine is half forward to defend his stumps.
punched to backward point, off the back foot.
and now Ervine must come forward to defend, the ball rolling gently to extra cover.
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler.
Hamza comes round the wicket, Mutumbami punches to cover off the back foot.
driven to mid on
Hamza has his hands in his head as Mutumbami backs away, exposing all three stumps, and punches to point.
turned against the spin to midwicket.
eased down the ground for a single to long on.
no width to work with, and Mutumbami is back and across to defend.
Mutumbami jumps down the track at the fast bowler, but doesn't quite find the length he's looking for and opts for a tame glide down to third man
Aftab comes round the wicket to Ervine, who drive to mid-on.
a back of a length delivery rises up towards Ervine's ribs, but he rides the bounce in defence.
there are no slips in place, but there's plenty of defensive protection in the covers, and Ervine's drive goes straight to a fielder.
a surprise yorker on off stump is dug out back to the bowler.
twirled down on off stump, defended back to the bowler.
again Mutumbami is forward to defend, this time the ball goes to cover,
Mutumbami skips down the track to meet the ball on the half volley, and drives to long on.
the bottom hand comes into the shot as Ervine fetches a delivery from outside off stump into the leg side.
watchful defence to a quicker ball from Hamza.

watch this! Another slog sweep from Mutumbami, and he's nailed it. He placed it well too, the ball coming to ground just in front of the advertising boards, and right between the long on and midwicket fielders.
pushed defensively to extra cover.
this time Ervine turns his forward defence into a drive, picking up a single to the cover sweeper.
Nabi fires one at Mutumbami's pads, and he finds two runs through square leg.
nicely swept by the right hander, along the ground, and the square leg fielder has to dive to save the boundary.
flicked off the pads, but straight to short fine leg.
another glance, and again it goes straight to the short fine leg fielder

now this is a big one! Mutumbami is playing the slog sweep really well this afternoon. He came forward and met the ball with a full swing, sending it arcing out to deep midwicket. It went over the boundary, over the brick stands, and bounced back off a tree behind the spectators.
much flatter and faster from Hamza, Mutumbami's cut is stopped at backward point.
Mutumbami aims squarer with this backfoot punch, and collects a single to the sweeper cover
turned with the spin to midwicket.
a short ball sits up outside off stump and Ervine cuts it through the point and cover point fielders. The shot doesn't quite have the legs to reach the boundary.
Hamza's final ball grips and spins in, hurrying Ervine's defence.

he's played the shot well, but now it's brought about his downfall! Mutumbami swept hard at this one, but the ball bounced on him and a top edge looped to short fine leg. The fielder there had plenty of ground to cover, but timed his dive just right to hold the ball inches above the turf.
turned to square leg, against the spin.
flicked to midwicket.
driven just wide of mid on, and they pinch a quick single.
Ervine is well forward to push the ball back to the bowler
solid defence to end the over.
not a great delivery to start, much to short, and Chigumbura steps back to club him to the deep midwicket boundary.
flat and fast through the air, defended to point.
pushed through outside off, Mutombodzi leaves it alone.
not a lot of flight, but the ball is nicely straight and Mutombodzi defends.
spinning away from the bat outside off, cut hard out to the sweeper cover
flicked with the spin through square leg.
pushed back to the bowler.
driven to extra cover, straight to the fielder.
again Ervine is forward, and pushes the ball back to the bowler.
pitched right up to the bat, and Ervine drives to long off.
turned with the spin to midwicket.
eased down the ground to long on for one.
hustled through just outside off, and Tino raises his arms to leave.

he does have some variation! Tino jumped down the track at this one, but it bit into the turf and spun back into him. He didn't read it, and he's lucky that the ball evaded the keeper or else he might have been stumped.
pushed down the leg side.
very nicely swept by Ervine. The short fine leg fielder has plenty to do to cut it off, but manages to do so.
edged! But past the diving slip. Again that man at short fine has to hare after it, and again he manages to flick the ball back into the field of play just in time.
driven back past the bowler, who gets half a hand to it but can't stop the single.
the googly again! Tino comes well forward though, and the ball pops harmlessly off the inside half of his bat.
Ervine gets down really low to sweep, fetching the ball from an off stump line and placing it just well enough to beat a diving fielder at deep square leg.
pushed through very flat on off stump, Ervine defends.
this one rushes on with the arm, and Ervine pushes it back to the bowler.
too short, sitting up and asking to be hit. Ervine steps back and strikes the ball hard to wide long on, deliberately hitting in the air.
and now Ervine waits deep in the crease, letting the ball come to him, and nudging through the gap at midwicket.
Nabi holds this one back just a little, and Tino comes forward to defend it back down the track.
an appeal for lbw! But it was only from the bowler, and it was optimistic. Pitching outside leg stump, and headed further that way.
short, and pulled out to the sweeper on the deep midwicket boundary.
left alone outside off stump.
and again, left alone. Mutumbodzi must be quite confident reading the bowler, as we've seen some variation from him.
a little too full on the batsman's legs, and he slams a drive hard down to long on.
nicely played by Ervine, waiting on the ball and cutting it very late through short third man.
no width for the batsman to work with, on either side, and he nudges the ball carefully back down the pitch
flicked to midwicket, and the fielder is quickly around to cut it off.
turned with the spin to midwicket once more.
watchfully pushed back to the bowler

pushed with a very wristy flick to the point fielder. Almost reminiscent of Owais Shah in that shot. Tino is all wrist, and the ball goes through point though his follow through ends up behind his left ear.
punted down the ground for a single.
yet again Tino lets one go outside off. He's not keen to play if he doesn't have to, just yet.
athletic fielding! Rashid leaps to his right to stop this drive in mid air off his own bowling.
turn outside off stump! Tino had come forward to drive, but was beaten.
pushed through extra cover, the batsman playing off the back foot.
Ervine lunges well forward to defend.
muscled to midwicket, with the spin, but straight to the fielder
the bowler comes round the wicket, the batsman flicks to midwicket.
nicely straight, pushed back to the bowler.
and again. A definite hint of turn for the bowler.

what was Ervine thinking here? Tino flicked to midwicket, where the fielder fumbled slightly. Tino called "no!" as Ervine wandered out, ball-watching, and then "no!" again as he kept going. No harm done though.
driven to extra cover.
a backfoot punch sends the ball to extra cover once again.
eased down to long off for one
Tino was thinking about leaving this, but withdrew his bat too late, the ball popping off the bottom edge and rolling to short third man.
beaten by the turn outside off, pressing forward
and again! Rashid has really found his rhythm now. This ball fizzed right past Tino, and Shahzad whipped off the bails for good measure.
the batsman answers back! Tino backed away to leg, reading the length early, and lasered a drive handsomely through extra cover.
Rashid tries the wrong 'un, and the ball takes the inside half of the bat before rolling into space at midwicket.
flicked off the pads, in front of square on the leg side.
Hamza switches back to over the wicket to the left-handed Ervine, whose drive is intercepted by a diving straight midwicket fielder.
a touch too full, and he's driven to long-on.
a sliced cut to a ball outside off bounces out to the cover
Ervine presents the full face of the bat to a flighted delivery, earning a single to long-on.
that wristy, angled drive to cover from Tino again, and he places it well enough for a sharp single.
another sliced cut from Tino, and the top edge bounces down to third man.
an appeal for caught behind! Again Tino wanted to cut, but this time the ball burst past him. Afghanistan's appeal was loud and immediate, but the umpire couldn't be convinced.
defended to cover
driven this time, up and over cover, and they rush back for the second.
left alone outside off stump, the ball spinning away from the right-hander.
crouching defence ends the over.
Ervine skips down the track, but Hamza spots him coming and pulls his length back.
this time the bowler pitches it too short, and Ervine steps back to hammer the ball down to the long on fielder.
cut very late indeed down to third man, and it's fine enough to allow them time to sprint back for the single.
the ball rushes on with the arm, and is turned to midwicket

oh what a catch! Mutombodzi stepped back and lifted a drive inside out over extra cover, but couldn't get it quite square enough of the fielder running in from long off. It was Shafiqullah down there, I think, who is on as a sub fielder for Noor Ali. He had a lot of ground to cover, and had to dive too, but the ball stuck in his palm. Afghanistan snaffle another one!
Ervine chips in the air, but safely wide of the straight midwicket fielder.
the legspinner twirls one down on middle and off, and Ervine drives to straight midwicket.
glanced, but straight to the man at short fine leg.

Ervine falls, Afghanistan are surging! Well, Shenwari's caught and bowled has saved his face. Ervine stepped down the track and hammered the ball straight back at him, and Shenwari stuck a hand up just in time. Somehow, the ball stuck, and the bowler set off in frenzied celebration towards fine leg.
flicked against the spin to midwicket.
way, way down the leg side. Perhaps he though Raza was going to come down the track?
driven back to the bowler, who dives to his left to stop the ball. Energetic stuff.
and Raza steps forward to defend the last ball right under his eyes.
twirled down on off stump, Chigumbura coming well forward in defence.
pushed through flatter, and Chigumbura hurries his defence from the crease.
this one lands a little too full to have the batsman defending, and he drives to long off for one.
flighted up nice and high, above the batsman's eyeline, but Raza watches it all the way and drives to long off.
chopped down to point.
Chigumbura steps forward to drive into the leg side, the straight midwicket fielder rushing around to stop the shot
pushed gently to cover off the front foot
the bowler pulls this one down too short, and Raza gets right back to pull to mid on.
this one shot straight on with the arm, and Chigumbura was very nearly bowled through the gate!
outside off stump, and worked to point.
Chigumbura steps back and punches a good length delivery from Rashid to cover
again this delivery seems to flip straight on, and Chigumbura nudges to mid on.
eased down to long-on.
crunched out through cover point to the sweeper on the off side.
Shenwari scoots this one a little too far down the leg side.

And there you go. Panic stations, everyone. He's bowled him! Shenwari has set off for the midwicket boundary, roaring in celebration, and Shahzad looks like he wants to smash the disturbed stumps down! Raza is slumped in the crease. He didn't read this one, that zipped straight on without spinning and also kept really low. Afghanistan are well on top now!
almost chipped back to the bowler! Shahzad leaves his station behind the stumps to come and congratulate Chisoro on the great shot. Or to discuss the fine weather perhaps?
pushed through a little short outside off stump, and Chisoro cuts to point.
turned with the spin to square leg, through the gap.
Chisoro stays deep in the crease to defend to leg.
the ball squirts off the leading edge and rolls to cover.
defended from the crease.
Chisoro is forward now to defend again, to leg.
turned with the spin, defensively, into the leg side
the wrong 'un, and I'm not convinced he read it! The ball takes the leading edge, but goes quickly to ground on the off side.
zipped through flat and fast by Shenwari. The ball doesn't bounce much again, but Chigumbura gets the bat down in time to find a single to long on.
down the leg side, called wide.
looped up very full, the left handed batsman drives back to the bowler
no gap to be found at all. Now the ball rolls to short fine leg.
Chisoro comes well forward to defend to extra cover
pushed way down the leg side again, a big wide.
precious little flight, and Chisoro stays back to defend this one
soaring into the stands beyond deep midwicket! This one slipped out as a high full toss, outside off, and Chisoro absolutely murdered it over midwicket. Huge.

Chisoro's blood is rushing now. He wants another big shot into the leg side, but the ball takes a thick edge and bounces down to the third man boundary. Zimbabwe will take them wherever they can get them.
Chigumbura's punchy little drive just evades a diving extra cover fielder, and they scoot through for a single.
Rashid comes round the wicket to Chisoro, who drives him to long-off.
there's the variation. The ball rushes straight on to test Chigumbura's defence. He seemed to pick it.
too short, but fortunately he's got protection on the midwicket boundary for this pull shot.
turned with the spin to the man at straight midwicket.
tapped back to the bowler.
wobbling around on a length, just outside off, and Chigumbura nudges to point
well, there's an appeal for caught behind from Shahzad, but one feels it's rather fanciful. Daylight between bat and ball.
a rising delivery outside off is pushed to point once more.
and now Dawlat slings down a full ball on middle and off. Chigumbura comes forward in defence to meet it.
Dawlat isn't offering the batsman anything to hit, and this length delivery cramps his defence.
this ball, full and straight, seams to snake in through the air, but Chigumbura connects well enough to find a single to long-on.
adventurous running! Chigumbura pushed this just to the left of the cover fielder, but Chisoro called for the single. The throw is good, but he's safe.

not for long! Chisoro jumps down the track and swings mightily out to wide long on with rather more height than distance in the shot. It's not an easy catch, but the fielder does well to get into position underneath it and hold on. This is surely Afghanistan's game now!
pushed defensively to cover point.
Chigumbura is forward to defend once again.
nudged back to the bowler.
play and a miss to end the over! Chigumbura was trying to run it down to third man.
down the leg side, called wide. Dawlat is definitely finding movement in to the right-hander now. Reverse swing? Looks like it.
wide outside off, and Jongwe chops down on it to find a single to third man.
full, outside off, and it's driven to extra cover.
nicely bowled once more, very full outside off, and Chigumbura digs out the drive to cover.
Dawlat pulls his length back, and Chigumbura hops up on his toes to defend to point.
struck on the pad! But the appeal is quickly stifled. Clearly heading down leg.
a slashed cut is cleanly stopped at point, and the required rate touches nine.
very full, dug out to mid on
very full once more, and bowled quite flat. Again he's turned to leg
pushed through wider of off now, and Jongwe leans across to defend
really tight bowling, Jongwe has nothing to hit and offers only a forward defensive
past the outside edge! But no harm done
and rather more solid defence ends the over
he aims for the yorker first up, but doesn't quite get it right and Chigumbura drives to long on
driven down the ground, just the single
has this hit the boot, or the pad? It went well down the leg side, so it must have hit something or else it would have been wide.
appeal for lbw! But this has hit bat, and then pad I think. The umpire isn't interested
full on off stump, and defended to cover
full, inswinging yorker, but it's dug out just in time
looped down full and wide outside off, and he squirts the drive through cover point.
Chigumbura gets right back and punches to cover. Jongwe wanted a single, though I'm not sure where from as the ball went straight to the fielder.
punched firmly to cover once again.
off the edge! But the ball evades the keeper and bounces down to third man for a hard-run three.
Jongwe comes down the track, but almost yorks himself in the process.
placement on the cut! This shot wasn't powered away, but he got enough on it to reach the boundary, and placed it perfectly behind point.
Chigumbura jumps down the track to meet this one the full, slamming a drive straight down the ground. Long-off gets across in time to save the boundary
driven hard, but straight to the man on the edge of the cover circle.
down to long-on this time, and he gets the single.
reverse sweep! This has flown off the middle of the bat, Jongwe blazing the reverse stroke down to the vacant third man boundary
and he turns the strike over with a single to long on, as a Mexican wave starts up in the grandstands to my left.
driven to long-off for another single
Chigumbura misses his drive outside off to a half volley, Shahzad fumbles his take and they sneak a bye.
a touch short, and rising up on leg stump. Jongwe rolls his wrists over a pull to deep square leg.
off the inside edge! Chigumbura got the bat down just in time on this yorker, but that was close.

that's an audacious shot! Jongwe likes the paddle scoop, and he's nailed this one. Aftab was looking for the yorker, but Jongwe stuck his bat out to turn it into a full toss and lifted it straight over wicketkeeper Shahzad's head.
now the batsman stands at the crease and guides the ball straight to the man at short third. Either side of him and that would have been four more.
chipped down the ground, and they sprint through for a single as long on charges in.
Jongwe backs right away to leg, way back, exposing all of his stumps, and then misses his cut ... But fortunately for him the ball bounces up over the top of middle.
heaved out into the leg side, and deep midwicket runs in to keep them to one.
a wristy little flick sends the ball racing between the long on and midwicket fielders, and there's room for the batsmen to rush through for two.
driven along the carpet, and stopped by the cover fielder.
glanced through midwicket for a single.
powered down the ground! Jongwe is going to go down swinging. He jumps down the track and slams the ball straight, not bothering to keep it down.
very full, right up to him, and Chigumbura lays bat to ball to reach the man at short fine leg. A hurried single.

brutal! Chigumbura may have temporarily lost his shots, but Jongwe has found all of them. He read this length delivery early and shellacked it out to deep midwicket.  The ball never got up too high, but it beat the jumping fielder and slammed into the advertising boards.

Jongwe jams a yorker back to the bowler now, and Aftab fires a throw back to demolish his stumps! Jongwe was safely inside the crease, and stays right where he is as Aftab comes closer for a quick word.
inside out over cover now! Jongwe is playing a gem of a knock. This was full and wide outside off, and Jongwe lifted it cleanly to the extra cover boundary. One bounce.
now he goes full again, and Jongwe drives down to long-on.
short and wide outside off, but Chigumbura's cut goes straight to backward point.
full toss, outside off, and Jongwe drives it to the man on the edge of the cover circle.
another full toss, and this time he drives it hard enough that it pops out of the cover fielder's hands and they take a single.

with fine leg up, Chigumbura aims for a paddle sweep. But Dawlat sent down a slower ball that he didn't quite read, and he's struck on the pad. Outside off, by the looks of things, and they steal a single.
full toss once again, and Jongwe still can't get it past the man at cover. Just another single
clubbed away to wide long on, but not out of the middle of the bat. The placement is such that they hurry back for the second.
another slower ball. Chigumbura was winding up to have a full go, but checked his shot and slotted the ball into the covers instead.
crunched out of the middle of the bat, but straight down to the long on fielder. In case you hadn't noticed, this is already Jongwe's highest score in internationals.
Jongwe finds the vital boundary! He was aiming for wide long on, but the ball curved in to him and flew off the inside half of the bat and down to long leg. They all count!
a yorker bounces off Jongwe's left foot and rolls to leg, and they charge through for a leg bye.

Chigumbura departs! He'd not been able to find the boundary even once in this innings, and needed to hit out at every ball. This was the ball to hit - a length delivery on middle and leg - but he picked out the fielder at deep midwicket. An off, off-colour innings. Though Jongwe remains, this should be the game in the bag for Afghanistan.
Jongwe, meanwhile, is unfazed! Another length delivery is flapped up and over square leg, right into the gap, and away for four.
Aftab fires down a bouncer, and Jongwe hooks it down to fine leg to keep the strike.
a low full toss, on off stump, is slapped to mid-off.
full and wide outside off, and Masakadza can't get close with a booming drive.
definite, late reverse swing for Dawlat, away from the left-hander. Again it's full and wide outside off, and again he can't lay bat to ball.
squeezed out to point, right off the toe end as it left him late through the air
a full toss on middle is punted down the ground, but just the one run. Afghanistan won't mind that, as it means Masakadza may well be on strike again in the next over.

fierce yorker! Jongwe wanted to drive through extra cover, but this fast, reverse swinging yorker zipped under his bat in a flash. Dawlat Zadran celebrates, and Afghanistan close in on a series-leveling win.

and another! Zimbabwe are crumbling away. Aftab followed Dawlat's cue and fired down a fast yorker right at the batsman's toes. Masakadza swung right over the top of it, and his middle stump was knocked clear out of the ground.
tip-and-run single for Nyumbu, just behind point to get off the mark. Ironic cheers from the crowd.
Panyangara backs away and hacks a length delivery through the covers without much timing.

all done! Nyumbu slaps to point, but he doesn't want to run. Panyangara, however, does and keeps going even as his partner tries to send him back. Eventually Nyumbu decides he must go, but by then Aftab has the ball in his hands and he makes a mess of the stumps at the non-striker's end, rocketing a full strength throw at them from about half a foot away. An emphatic way to level the series!
